intro: Sisymbrium erodiifolium, commonly known as hoary whitlowgrass, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring. Sisymbrium erodiifolium is typically found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
